Name: Mourner
Description: From the end of the Old Kingdom, the Egyptians deposited numerous figurines and models in their tombs. In accordance with their magical concepts, these objects were used by the deceased and protected them against all attacks of "Evil" in the Afterlife. Amongst the statuettes and figurines have been found mourners. The Brussels Museum posseses four figurines of mourners in terracotta, which date from the 1st Intermediate Period. The women are very characteristic: they are striking their naked chest, raising their arms in despair, or are bent by grief. This first piece depicts a mourner, with naked chest, pointing her left hand to her temple.
